      • degMinSecToDouble

        public static double degMinSecToDouble(org.apache.commons.imaging.common.RationalNumber[] degMinSec,
                                       java.lang.String ref)
        Calculates the decimal degree-value from a degree value given in degrees-minutes-seconds-format
        Parameters:
        degMinSec - an array of length 3, the values in there are (in this order) degrees, minutes and seconds
        ref - the latitude or longitude reference determining if the given value is:
        • north ( GpsTagConstants.GPS_TAG_GPS_LATITUDE_REF_VALUE_NORTH) or south ( GpsTagConstants.GPS_TAG_GPS_LATITUDE_REF_VALUE_SOUTH) of the equator
        • east ( GpsTagConstants.GPS_TAG_GPS_LONGITUDE_REF_VALUE_EAST) or west (GpsTagConstants.GPS_TAG_GPS_LONGITUDE_REF_VALUE_WEST ) of the equator
        Returns:
        the decimal degree-value for the given input, negative when west of 0-meridian or south of equator, positive otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if degMinSec doesn't have length 3 or if ref is not one of the values mentioned above

      • getEpoch

        public static long getEpoch(java.lang.String date,
                            java.lang.String format)
                     throws java.text.ParseException
        Parses a string with a given format and returns the Epoch time.
        Parameters:
        date - The string containing the date.
        format - The format of the date.
        Returns:
        The date in Epoch format.
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException

      • readJPG

        public static MapillaryImportedImage readJPG(java.io.File file)
                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                             org.apache.commons.imaging.ImageReadException
        Reads a JPG pictures that contains the needed GPS information (position and direction) and creates a new icon in that position.
        Parameters:
        file - The file where the picture is located.
        Returns:
        The imported image.
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.imaging.ImageReadException - If the file isn't an image.
        java.io.IOException - If the file doesn't have the valid metadata.

      • readJPG

        public static MapillaryImportedImage readJPG(java.io.File file,
                                             boolean exceptionNoTags)
                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                             org.apache.commons.imaging.ImageReadException
        Reads a JPG pictures that contains the needed GPS information (position and direction) and creates a new icon in that position.
        Parameters:
        file - The File where the picture is located.
        exceptionNoTags - true if an exception must be thrown if the image doesn't have all the needed EXIF tags; false returns an image in the center of the screen.
        Returns:
        The imported image, whose data has been extracted from the picture's metadata.
        Throws:
        org.apache.commons.imaging.ImageReadException - If the File isn't an image.
        java.io.IOException - If the File doesn't have the valid metadata.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if exceptionNoTags is set to true and the image doesn't have the needed EXIF tags.

      • readNoTags

        public static MapillaryImportedImage readNoTags(java.io.File file)
        Reads a image file that doesn't contain the needed GPS information. And creates a new icon in the middle of the map.
        Parameters:
        file - The file where the image is located.
        Returns:
        The imported image.

      • readNoTags

        public static MapillaryImportedImage readNoTags(java.io.File file,
                                                org.openstreetmap.josm.data.coor.LatLon pos)
        Reads a image file that doesn't contain the needed GPS information. And creates a new icon in the middle of the map.
        Parameters:
        file - The file where the image is located.
        pos - A LatLon object indicating the position in the map where the image must be set.
        Returns:
        The imported image.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The imported image.
